titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia, Lewis E 47: Bible Commentary
titleStmt.funder: Council on Library and Information Resources

notesStmt.note: All paper including flyleaves is frame ruled; text ends on fol. 146 but the last two blank leaves are foliated

Free Library of Philadelphia, A Descriptive Catalogue of the John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts in the Free Library of Philadelphia, compiled by Edwin Wolf, 2nd, with an introduction by Dr. A.S.W. Rosenbach (Philadelphia: The Free Library, 1937), p. 53, no. 47.

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This manuscript contains a collection of commentaries on the Bible, including several works by Saint Jerome and an unidentified text.

msItem.title: Bible Commentary
msItem.author: Jerome, Saint, d. 419 or 420
Seneca, Lucius Annaeus, approximately 4 B.C.-65 A.D.

msItem.title: Expositio in Canticum canticorum
msItem.incipit: Osculet[ur] me oscula oris sin quia melio[r]a su[n]t ubera tua vino fragranta ungu[en]t[i]s optimus. Ad evidentiam huius libri vz [?] qui cantica conticarum minicipat[ur]
msItem.explicit: Ex sit est finis. Sit laus deo m[er]c[e]s

msItem.title: Theological treatise beginning: Credo deum omnia posse . . .
Unidentified short text about the Seven Sins
S. Hieronymus, Contra Rufinum
msItem.incipit: Lectis l[itte]ris prude[n]tie tue, quib[us] i[n] me i[n]veheris
msItem.explicit: … refestinante eo qui ad te remeabat, malui paucis ad te qua[m] ad alios.

msItem.title: Lucianus, Compariatio Alexandri, Hannibalis et Scipionis, translated from Greek into Latin by Aurispa
S. Hieronymus, De prima essentia divinatis Dei
S. Hieronymus, De XV signis Judicii
Seneca. Proverbia, alphabetice
msItem.explicit: Podiari sple[n]doru[m] sup[er]at qui sapie[n] sple[n]doru[m] chorus

msItem.title: Excerpt from Petrus de Riga, Aurora
Florilegia from Church Fathers (fol. 129r-146v)
msItem.incipit: Nemo t[ibi] Chr[istum] auferre, nisi te illi ip[s]e auferas
msItem.explicit: Origin[u]s: ecce m[u]l[ie]r[caput] pec[cat]i arma dya[bol]i expulsion pa[ra]disi dilecti m[at]e[r] corrupt[t]io legis antiq[ae]

support.watermark: Bull's head surmounted by a rose - Briquet No. 14, 777?

supportDesc.extent: iii+148; 203 x 144 mm bound to 214 x 153 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto

layoutDesc.layout: One column of thirty-one lines, frame ruled in ink or lead

decoDesc.decoNote: Two- and three-line red initials throughout; some texts have running titles

binding.p: Nineteenth-century half brown Russia leather with marbled paper over pasteboard; corner tipped in leather

history.provenance: Horatius Bosner, D. D.; Walter Raglan Hubbard (1890); John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936.
